clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Effects of Lavender Aromatherapy on Preoperative Anxiety in Breast Surgery Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Prospective Placebo-Controlled Study of the Effects of Lavender Aromatherapy on Preoperative Anxiety in Breast Surgery Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effects of lavender aromatherapy on preoperative anxiety by measuring changes in pulse rate and anxiety core using Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Index questionnaires and on postoperative pain medicine usage. Study participants will then be randomized into one of four groups; either they will receive 2 drops of lavender (Lavandula Angustifolia) oil (LO) or 2 drops of Michelia Alba Leaf oil (MA) or 2 drops of unscented Almond oil (AO) or two drops water on the inside of an oxygen face mask for 15 minutes. Linalool makes up ~30% of Lavandula Angustifolia oil and is believed to be its most active anti-anxiety component. Before and after treatment, anxiety level will be measured using the Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Inventory.

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in anxiety as measured by the change in baseline STAI scores
primary_outcome.description: Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) is a self-reported instrument. It was designed to assess levels of state anxiety and traint anxiety, through 40 items scored by a likert-scale. State anxiety can be defined as a transient momentary emotional status that results from situational stress.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women, older than 18, American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) classification I-III, undergoing elective breast surgery on Tisch 10th floor Day Surgery. Cancer patients are included.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of asthma, bronchitis, COPD, contact dermatitis to cosmetic fragrances, positive patch test, pregnancy, and significant laboratory abnormalities.
